title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at The New Jewish Home
Interview Descriptions: It was good and easy process. You come in interview it took 10 minutes went over resume, asked a few questions and that’s about it. Afterwards I went to hr and spoke to someone and she let me know anything that I needed to bring, also later on that day got a confirmation email about working there.
Interview Questions: I got asked vital signs questions

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The New Jewish Home (New York, NY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: my interviewers were very warm and welcoming and I was even more eager to come and work. They were very well-versed on the topic at hand and i learned so much within 1-hour.
Interview Questions:
tell me about yourself? 
What was a challenge that you had to overcome

title: Director of Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at The New Jewish Home (New York, NY) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Was ghosted! After 5 rounds of interviews, all of which were hastily scheduled, the company ghosted me. I never heard back from neither the hiring manager, with whom I had had several conversations nor the HR coordinator. I wrote the HR coordinator once to follow up and the coordinator said they would let me know...it's been 3 months.
Interview Questions: They wanted to know detailed information about what tools I used.

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at The New Jewish Home (New York, NY) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Applied. 2 weeks later phone interview with HR. 
Week later Interview with Regional Director 
Week later interview with VP of QA
Same day tour of site, interviewed by staff and another PD who pretty much let me know that I wasn't appropriate for the job (this was an all day process). 

It's been 2 months since all of these interviews so I believe it's safe to say I didn't get the job. Attempted to follow-up with HR but no response.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at The New Jewish Home (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was easy enough. I had to interview with both HR and Finance, luckily I was able to get both interviews scheduled together. 
I first met with HR then after the HR interview I was led to another building where I interviewed with 2 directors of finance. 
The questions were generic, and not too challenging. Reading prep questions online helped me to prepare. 
A few days after I got a call from HR with an offer

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at The New Jewish Home (New York, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: was casual and very well put and straight to the point i was made to feel very comfortable. my entire resume was reviewed and specific details were asked about each employer. Another employee was there to chime in on specifics on job assignments

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at The New Jewish Home (New York, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy, behavioral interview. No technical questions asked. It was held at the Manhattan location. I was interviewed by two people who wanted to know my background. Nothing extraordinary. People are professional and welcoming. Overall was short and to the point.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background? What did you study at school. Tell me about your previous professional experience.

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at The New Jewish Home (New York, NY) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I added my profile on their career page and was called shortly after by their HR representative, we I meet with and who gave me some additional information about the job I would be applying for. The same day I met with the coordinator of the program that I was applying for. The interview was about a half hour long. They let me know that day that I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you were challenged in your work and how you mitigated that challenge.

title: Hha Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The New Jewish Home (Bronx, NY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The recruitment process is very professional and they treat you as a professional not just some number like some of these other agencies. The recruitment staff walks you through the process asking very detailed information, which I liked since they don't just hire any john doe from the street. itt seems like they really care about ensuring that they hire the right people for the job. I have been an aide for more than 5 years and I can say that they treated me with respect and made me feel very proud of being a "hero". that is what they consider us aides...heros! I am glad I joined them.
Interview Questions: why did you chose to become an HHA? what sort of person would you allow to take care of your parent?

title: NORC Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The New Jewish Home (Bronx, NY) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with HR director who was very nice and actually refer me to a different position after I didn't get the initially position I applied for. Met with the direct supervisor right after. Whole interview process was around 2-2 1/2 hours long. Second part of interview there was a nurse that was present for half of the interview to assess the clinical portion of my skills.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths?
What are some challenges you have faced in the past?

title: Case Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at The New Jewish Home (New York, NY) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was asked professional questions and explained my salary.  The interviewer was professional and did a good job, She did not rush the interview listened to me and gave me a chance to answer questions. She answered questions about the job and the mission.  I was given a chance to work in either the Bronx or Manhattan
Interview Questions: I was asked about my past experience

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at The New Jewish Home (New York, NY) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, called for interview about 2 weeks later, I should have have pulled the phone out of the wall!
